text:
i have a requirement where i need to use  CTI for HubSpot Crm.so just wanted to know that how to acheive that.
for <http://example.In|example.In> salesforce they provide i frame .
- In Msdynamics 365 they also provide i-frame .
so how to embed CTI in HubSpot crm.
How can I create timeline events in HubSpot ?

I am faceing some issue in the integrations  "status":"error","message":"Couldn't validate some supplied token values: Event [id 11491421-f379-40e1-9a26-07a63859efb4 | eventTypeId 1284181] does not contain property [user_progress_survey_id]. Must be one of [survey_id, channel, started_at, survey_name]","correlationId":"d8fe5175-abaf-46c8-b803-1f7d8f5210ea","context":{"errorDetails":["Event [id 11491421-f379-40e1-9a26-07a63859efb4 | eventTypeId 1284181] does not contain property [user_progress_survey_id]. Must be one of [survey_id, channel, started_at, survey_name]"]},"category":"VALIDATION_ERROR","subCategory":"TimelineEventErrors.INVALID_TOKENS_ERROR" i am getting ths error

Hey all!

I have a strange issue with webhooks and workflows. I have a couple of workflows with corresponding webhooks setup in our test environment. From a external backend service, I would like to post data to the webhooks in order to update e.g. contacts in HubSpot.

From my backend, I get a successful response back and no errors, but the workflow isn’t triggered. If I use the EXACT same body (copy’n’paste from the logs) and send it to the webhook through Postman, the workflow works as expected. Any thoughts?
It's saying that you're not providing the property `user_progress_survey_id]` which is required. You must have defined that property as a token on the event type

<@U03REFNRMB3>, A user is having trouble installing our app, which isn’t in the marketplace yet due to needing more installs. The superadmin granted all necessary permissions, but the user still can’t use it, while the superadmin can. Previously, another user accessed it without issues. I believe the problem may be related to the app not being available in the marketplace, but I couldn’t find any mention of this in the documentation. I’m looking for a possible solution. Thank you!

When we send a dropdown select property via webhook through a HubSpot workflow, can the API capture all of the drop down menu items for that property, or can the API only see the current drop down property that is selected without being able to see all of the available drop down menu options available for selection?

The webhook will receive whichever data you send it.

The API can't see anything outside of the request payload.
